quote: A constitution is the arrangement of magistrates in a state.
author: Unknown

quote: A friend to all is a friend to none.
author: Unknown

quote: A likely impossibility is always preferable to an unconvincing possibility.
author: Unknown

quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.
author: Unknown

quote: All human beings, by nature, desire to know.
author: Unknown

quote: All men by nature desire knowledge.
author: Unknown

quote: Anybody can become angry – that is easy, but to be angry with the right person and to the right degree and at the right time and for the right purpose, and in the right way – that is not within everybody’s power and is not easy.
author: Unknown

quote: At his best, man is the noblest of all animals; separated from law and justice he is the worst.
author: Unknown

quote: Change in all things is sweet.
author: Unknown

quote: Character may almost be called the most effective means of persuasion.
author: Unknown

quote: Comedy aims at representing men as worse, Tragedy as better than in actual life.
author: Unknown

quote: Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others.
author: Unknown

quote: Criticism is something we can avoid easily by saying nothing, doing nothing, and being nothing.
author: Unknown

quote: Democracy is when the indigent, and not the men of property, are the rulers.
author: Unknown

quote: Dignity does not consist in possessing honors, but in deserving them.
author: Unknown

quote: Each man judges well the things he knows.
author: Unknown

quote: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
author: Unknown

quote: Education is an ornament in prosperity and a refuge in adversity.
author: Unknown

quote: Equality consists in the same treatment of similar persons.
author: Unknown

quote: Even when laws have been written down, they ought not always to remain unaltered.
author: Unknown

quote: Every rascal is not a thief, but every thief is a rascal.
author: Unknown

quote: Excellence is an art won by training and habituation. We do not act rightly because we have virtue or excellence, but we rather have those because we have acted rightly. We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
author: Unknown

quote: Excellence is never an accident. It is always the result of high intention, sincere effort, and intelligent execution; it represents the wise choice of many alternatives – choice, not chance, determines your destiny.
author: Unknown

quote: Fear is pain arising from the anticipation of evil.
author: Unknown

quote: For what is the best choice, for each individual is the highest it is possible for him to achieve.
author: Unknown

quote: Friends hold a mirror up to each other; through that mirror they can see each other in ways that would not otherwise be accessible to them, and it is this mirroring that helps them improve themselves as persons.
author: Unknown

quote: Friendship is essentially a partnership.
author: Unknown

quote: Good habits formed at youth make all the difference.
author: Unknown

quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Unknown

quote: Happiness is activity.
author: Unknown

quote: Happiness is an expression of the soul in considered actions.
author: Unknown

quote: Happiness is the settling of the soul into its most appropriate spot.
author: Unknown

quote: He who has never learned to obey cannot be a good commander.
author: Unknown

quote: He who is to be a good ruler must have first been ruled.
author: Unknown

quote: Hope is a waking dream.
author: Unknown

quote: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies; for the hardest victory is over self.
author: Unknown

quote: I have gained this by philosophy that I do without being commanded what others do only from fear of the law.
author: Unknown

quote: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.
author: Unknown

quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Unknown

quote: It is easy to perform a good action, but not easy to acquire a settled habit of performing such actions.
author: Unknown

quote: It is not enough to win a war; it is more important to organize the peace.
author: Unknown

quote: It is possible to fail in many ways…while to succeed is possible only in one way.
author: Unknown

quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Unknown

quote: It is well to be up before daybreak, for such habits contribute to health, wealth, and wisdom.
author: Unknown

quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Unknown

quote: Liars when they speak the truth are not believed.
author: Unknown

quote: Love is composed of single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Unknown

quote: Man is a goal seeking animal. His life only has meaning if he is reaching out and striving for his goals.
author: Unknown

quote: Man is by nature a political animal.
author: Unknown

quote: Men acquire particular quality by constantly acting in a particular way.
author: Unknown

quote: Men are swayed more by fear than by reverence.
author: Unknown

quote: Men create gods after their own image, not only with regard to their form but with regard to their mode of life.
author: Unknown

quote: Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.
author: Unknown

quote: Most people would rather give than get affection.
author: Unknown

quote: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.
author: Unknown

quote: No notice is taken of a little evil, but when it increases it strikes the eye.
author: Unknown

quote: No one would choose a friendless existence on condition of having all the other things in the world.
author: Unknown

quote: Obstinate people can be divided into the opinionated, the ignorant, and the boorish.
author: Unknown

quote: Of all the varieties of virtues, liberalism is the most beloved.
author: Unknown

quote: Perfect friendship is the friendship of men who are good, and alike in excellence; for these wish well alike to each other qua good, and they are good in themselves.
author: Unknown

quote: Piety requires us to honor truth above our friends.
author: Unknown

quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Unknown

quote: Poetry demands a man with a special gift for it, or else one with a touch of madness in him.
author: Unknown

quote: Poetry is finer and more philosophical than history; for poetry expresses the universal, and history only the particular.
author: Unknown

quote: Poverty is the parent of revolution and crime.
author: Unknown

quote: Probable impossibilities are to be preferred to improbable possibilities.
author: Unknown

quote: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
author: Unknown

quote: Republics decline into democracies and democracies degenerate into despotism.
author: Unknown

quote: Something is infinite if, taking it quantity by quantity, we can always take something outside.
author: Unknown

quote: Teenagers these days are out of control. They eat like pigs, they are disrespectful of adults, they interrupt and contradict their parents, and they terrorize their teachers.
author: Unknown

quote: The actuality of thought is life.
author: Unknown

quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
author: Unknown

quote: The aim of the wise is not to secure pleasure, but to avoid pain.
author: Unknown

quote: The antidote for fifty enemies is one friend.
author: Unknown

quote: The beauty of the soul shines out when a man bears with composure one heavy mischance after another, not because he does not feel them, but because he is a man of high and heroic temper.
author: Unknown

quote: The difference between a learned man and an ignorant one is the same as that between a living man and a corpse.
author: Unknown

quote: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living from the dead.
author: Unknown

quote: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
author: Unknown

quote: The gods too are fond of a joke.
author: Unknown

quote: The greatest thing by far is to be a master of metaphor; it is the one thing that cannot be learned from others; and it is also a sign of genius, since a good metaphor implies an intuitive perception of the similarity of the dissimilar.
author: Unknown

quote: The happy life is regarded as a life in conformity with virtue. It is a life which involves effort and is not spent in amusement.
author: Unknown

quote: The ideal man bears the accidents of life with dignity and grace, making the best of circumstances.
author: Unknown

quote: The least initial deviation from the truth is multiplied later a thousand fold.
author: Unknown

quote: The most perfect political community is one in which the middle class is in control, and outnumbers both of the other classes.
author: Unknown

quote: The one exclusive sign of thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.
author: Unknown

quote: The one exclusive sign of thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.
author: Unknown

quote: The proof that you know something is that you are able to teach it.
author: Unknown

quote: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
author: Unknown

quote: The secret to humor is surprise.
author: Unknown

quote: The society that loses its grip on the past is in danger, for it produces men who know nothing but the present, and who are not aware that life had been, and could be, different from what it is.
author: Unknown

quote: The true and the approximately true are apprehended by the same faculty; it may also be noted that men have a sufficient natural instinct for what is true, and usually do arrive at the truth. Hence the man who makes a good guess at truth is likely to make a good guess at probabilities.
author: Unknown

quote: The ultimate value of life depends upon awareness and the power of contemplation rather than upon mere survival.
author: Unknown

quote: The worst form of inequality is to try to make unequal things equal.
author: Unknown

quote: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
author: Unknown

quote: This is the reason why mothers are more devoted to their children than fathers: it is that they suffer more in giving them birth and are more certain that they are their own.
author: Unknown

quote: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
author: Unknown

quote: Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.
author: Unknown

quote: Through discipline comes freedom.
author: Unknown

quote: To be conscious that we are perceiving or thinking is to be conscious of our own existence.
author: Unknown

quote: To love someone is to identify with them.
author: Unknown

quote: To the query, What is a friend? his reply was A single soul dwelling in two bodies.
author: Unknown

quote: To write well, express yourself like common people, but think like a wise man. Or, think as wise men do, but speak as the common people do.
author: Unknown

quote: We cannot learn without pain.
author: Unknown

quote: We live in deeds, not years; in thoughts, not breaths; in feelings, not in figures on a dial. We should count time by heart throbs. He most lives who thinks most, feels the noblest, acts the best.
author: Unknown

quote: We make war that we may live in peace.
author: Unknown

quote: We must be neither cowardly nor rash but courageous.
author: Unknown

quote: We praise a man who feels angry on the right grounds and against the right persons and also in the right manner at the right moment and for the right length of time.
author: Unknown

quote: Whosoever is delighted in solitude is either a wild beast or a god.
author: Unknown

quote: Why is it that all those who have become eminent in philosophy, politics, poetry, or the arts are clearly of an atrabilious temperament and some of them to such an extent as to be affected by diseases caused by black bile?
author: Unknown

quote: Wicked men obey from fear; good men, from love.
author: Unknown

quote: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow-ripening fruit.
author: Unknown

quote: Wit is educated insolence.
author: Unknown

quote: You will never do anything in the world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
author: Unknown
